{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pain perception is subjective and can vary from person to person. In newborns, it's even more difficult to assess due to their inability to communicate. However, minimal access surgeries are generally associated with less pain post-operatively compared to traditional open surgeries. This is due to smaller incisions, less tissue damage, and less post-operative complications. But it's important to note that any surgical procedure can cause discomfort or pain, and appropriate pain management is always necessary.", "answer_choice": "A"}
